subsection.title: Terminology

statement.p: A graph is a circuit, or closed walk, if and only if the vertices can be labeled v_0, v_1, \ldots, v_k such that \{v_j,v_{j+1}\} is an edge for all j and v_0=v_k.
A graph is a cycle if and only if it is a circuit such that no vertex is used twice.

subsection.p: A cycle on n vertices is denoted C_n. Likes walk and path terminology for cycles vary widely.

statement.p: A circuit is Eulerian if and only if it uses every edge in the graph and no edge is used twice.
A circuit is Hamiltonian if and only if it uses every vertex in that graph and no edge is used twice.
